alert.note: Alert for Dinwiddie; Prince George; Surry; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 27 at 12:28AM EDT until June 27 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 AM EDT FOR SOUTHERN PRINCE GEORGE...SUSSEX...SOUTHEASTERN DINWIDDIE AND WESTERN SURRY COUNTIES... At 1228 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Petersburg to near Carson to near Sussex, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. These severe storms will be near... Disputanta and Homeville around 1240 AM EDT. Waverly around 1245 AM EDT. Wakefield and Cabin Point around 1250 AM EDT. Dendron around 1255 AM EDT. Elberon around 105 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Booth Fork, Carsley, Newville, Burgess, Booker, Reams, Spring Grove, Lumberton, Ellis Fork and Huske. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
